text: Kenneth Lee Griffith (July 31, 1918 – June 5, 2005) was an American professional basketball player. He played for the Akron Goodyear Wingfoots in the National Basketball League and averaged 1.5 points per game. Griffith did not play competitive basketball until attending Alderson Broaddus University. In his career he scored 1,941 points and passed legendary Stanford player Hank Luisetti's for a then all-time college basketball career scoring record.
